snippet: Under pressure to get out of the race, Newt Gingrich has a new argument for continuing: Conservatives cannot block Mitt Romney’s path to the nomination without him.
abstract: Newt Gingrich and his advisers are not wavering from their promise to stay in the race until the party's convention in August; say that Mitt Romney can still be denied the delegates needed to win the nomination, and that Gingrich could made a case at the convention for himself as the party's best hope to defeat Pres Obama in the fall.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY

lead_paragraph: Under pressure to get out of the race, Newt Gingrich has a new argument for continuing: Conservatives cannot block Mitt Romney’s path to the nomination without him.

headline.seo: Gingrich Says He Can Stop Romney
headline.main: Gingrich Casts Himself as the Key to Stop Romney
headline.print_headline: Gingrich Casts Himself as the Key to Stop Romney
